Student topics: Microsoft Applied Skills: Create an AI agent
Weekly study hours: 6
Duration in weeks: 8

Produce JSON only matching the provided schema

{"results":[{"title":"Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Create an AI agent","content":"# Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Create an AI agent
## Purpose of this document
This study guide provides a summary of the topics covered in the assessment lab, along with additional resources to help you prepare. Note that the learning path on the credential details page may include more modules than the "Tasks performed" to provide a cohesive learning experience.
### Tasks at a glance
#### Create and configure agents by using the Microsoft Foundry portal
1. Create an agent project or a new agent
2. Create a new completion model deployment
3. Configure agent settings, including name, description, and instructions
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Get started with AI agent development on Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/ai-agent-fundamentals/)
#### Add knowledge sources and tools to an agent
1. Add files to the agent's vector store
2. Specify a connection to a knowledge source
3. Add a tool to the agent, such as Code Interpreter or an API tool
4. Test knowledge sources and tools by submitting user queries
  Supporting module (s):
4.1. [Develop a multi-agent solution with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)
#### Orchestrate multiple agents
1. Configure a connected agent
2. Test agent-to-agent conversation by submitting user queries
  Supporting module (s):
2.1. [Develop a multi-agent solution with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/applied-skills/resources/study-guides/apl-3031#purpose-of-this-document"},{"title":"Microsoft Applied Skills: Create agents in Microsoft Copilot Studio - Applied Skills","content":"Applied Skills 

# Microsoft Applied Skills: Create agents in Microsoft Copilot Studio

 Validate your technical skills and open doors to new possibilities of advancement with Microsoft Applied Skills.

Candidates for this credential should have experience with Copilot Studio, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft Power Platform.

## Purpose of this document
This study guide provides a summary of the topics covered in the assessment lab, along with additional resources to help you prepare. Note that the learning path on the credential details page may include more modules than the "Tasks performed" to provide a cohesive learning experience.
### Tasks at a glance
#### Prepare the development environment
1. Deploy an Azure OpenAI Service model
2. Retrieve and store an endpoint and a key
3. Create a new console application
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Build your kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/build-your-kernel/)
#### Run prompts with Semantic Kernel
1. Create a Semantic Kernel object
2. Create and run a prompt
  Supporting module (s):
2.1. [Create plugins for semantic kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-plugins-semantic-kernel/)
#### Improve the prompt
1. Refine the prompt to be more specific, such as changing the output format or the style
2. Define message roles in chat completion prompts
3. Add variables to the prompt
4. Add context to the prompt by using the ChatHistory object
5. Configure few-shot prompting
6. Save the prompt as a file
  Supporting module (s):
6.1. [Create plugins for semantic kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-plugins-semantic-kernel/)
#### Create native plug-ins for Semantic Kernel
1. Create native plug-ins for Semantic Kernel
2. Create and decorate a plug-in class
3. Invoke native function manually
4. Invoke native function automatically
5. Combine prompts and functions
  Supporting module (s):
5.1. [Give your AI agent skills](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/give-your-ai-agent-skills/)
#### Implement nested functions
1. Embed core plug-ins, including conversation summary and time
2. Use the Handlebars template prompt
3. Create and embed a custom nested function
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Combine Prompts and Functions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/combine-prompts-functions/)
3.2. [Give your AI agent skills](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/give-your-ai-agent-skills/)
#### Improve automation by using planners
1. Create a Handlebars planner
2. Create and run a plan
3. Save a plan
4. Optimize a plan by modifying the template
  Supporting module (s):
4.1. [Use intelligent planners](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/use-intelligent-planners/)
4.2. [Guided project - Create an AI travel agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/guided-project-create-ai-travel-agent/)","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/applied-skills/resources/study-guides/apl-2005#purpose-of-this-document"},{"title":"Step 1: Your First Agent (programming-language-csharp)","content":"# Step 1: Your First Agent (programming-language-csharp)
Create an agent and get a response — in just a few lines of code.
```dotnetcli
dotnet add package Azure.AI.OpenAI --prerelease
dotnet add package Azure.Identity
dotnet add package Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI --prerelease
```
Create the agent:
Run it:
```csharp
Console.WriteLine(await agent.RunAsync("What is the largest city in France?"));
```
Or stream the response:
```csharp
await foreach (var update in agent.RunStreamingAsync("Tell me a one-sentence fun fact."))
{
    Console.Write(update);
}
```
Tip
See the [full sample](https://github.com/microsoft/agent-framework/blob/main/dotnet/samples/01-get-started/01_HelloAgent.cs) for the complete runnable file.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/agent-framework/get-started/your-first-agent"},{"title":"Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Build a generative AI chat app","content":"# Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Build a generative AI chat app
## Purpose of this document
This study guide provides a summary of the topics covered in the assessment lab, along with additional resources to help you prepare. Note that the learning path on the credential details page may include more modules than the "Tasks performed" to provide a cohesive learning experience.
### Tasks at a glance
#### Prepare and deploy a model in Microsoft Foundry
1. Create a Microsoft Foundry project
2. Select an appropriate model based on benchmarks and quality metrics
3. Deploy a model
4. Evaluate model performance
5. Configure guardrails and safety controls
  Supporting module (s):
5.1. [Get started with AI agent development on Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/ai-agent-fundamentals/)
#### Create a chat app by using the Microsoft Foundry SDK
1. Set up the development environment
2. Write code to initialize the Microsoft Foundry client
3. Integrate chat functionality
4. Run and debug the app
  Supporting module (s):
4.1. [Develop an AI agent with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/)
#### Implement chat history
1. Create a chat history object
2. Write code to add user and agent messages to the object
3. Write code to add chat history to the conversation context
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Develop an AI agent with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/)","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/applied-skills/resources/study-guides/apl-3030#purpose-of-this-document"},{"title":"Microsoft Applied Skills: Develop generative AI apps with Azure OpenAI and Semantic Kernel - Applied Skills","content":"Applied Skills 

# Microsoft Applied Skills: Develop generative AI apps with Azure OpenAI and Semantic Kernel

 Validate your technical skills and open doors to new possibilities of advancement with Microsoft Applied Skills. 

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?levels=intermediate&credential_types=applied%20skills)
- Product 

[Azure OpenAI Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?products=azure-openai&credential_types=applied%20skills)
- Role 

[AI Engineer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?roles=ai-engineer&credential_types=applied%20skills)[Developer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?roles=developer&credential_types=applied%20skills)
- Subject 

[Natural language processing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?subjects=natural-language-processing&credential_types=applied%20skills)

## Overview

Warning

The English language version of this Applied Skill assessment lab was updated on April 30, 2025. Review the study guide linked in the Applied Skills resources section for details about these changes.

To earn this Microsoft Applied Skills credential, learners demonstrate the ability to develop AI agents by using Azure OpenAI Service and the Semantic Kernel SDK.

Candidates for this credential should be familiar with Visual Studio Code, C# programming, and Azure OpenAI.

### Skills earned upon completion

- Loading...

- Loading...","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/applied-skills/develop-ai-agents-using-microsoft-azure-openai-and-semantic-kernel/"},{"title":"Introduction to Microsoft AI Agent Solutions - Training","content":"# Introduction to Microsoft AI agent solutions

- Module
- 8 Units

 Beginner 

 Developer 

 App Maker 

 Azure 

 Microsoft 365 Copilot 

 Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat 

 Microsoft Copilot Studio 

Explore Microsoft AI agent solutions and gain clarity on when to adopt, extend, or develop custom agent solutions based on your scenario and objectives.

## Learning objectives

After completing this module, you should be able to:

- Identify core use cases for the out-of-the-box capabilities of Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot Chat, and first-party agents.
- Describe options for customizing and extending Microsoft 365 Copilot.
- Identify scenarios where building fully custom AI agents or generative AI applications is appropriate.
- Identify the key Microsoft development tools available for designing, building, extending, and deploying AI agents.
- Evaluate which Microsoft AI agent path best fits a given scenario.

## Prerequisites

- Familiarity with Microsoft 365 Copilot
- Basic knowledge of generative AI concepts (agent, model, orchestration, etc.)
- Familiarity with core Microsoft Cloud platforms (Microsoft 365, Power Platform, and Azure)

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

- [Introduction](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/1-introduction)
- [The Microsoft AI agent ecosystem](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/2-ai-agent-solutions-microsoft)
- [Maximize Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot Chat, and agents](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/3-microsoft-365-copilot-copilot-chat)
- [Customize and extend Microsoft 365 Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/4-customize-extend-microsoft-365-copilot)
- [Build custom AI agents and applications](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/5-build-custom-ai-agents-applications)
- [Compare AI agent solutions](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/6-choose-your-agent-solution)
- [Module assessment](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/7-knowledge-check)
- [Summary](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/8-summary)

Take the module assessment

 Module Assessment Results

Assess your understanding of this module. Sign in and answer all questions correctly to earn a pass designation on your profile.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/"},{"title":"Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service - Training","content":"# Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service

- Module
- 7 Units

 Intermediate 

 AI Engineer 

 Developer 

 Solution Architect 

 Student 

 Azure OpenAI Service 

 Azure 

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building agents with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.

##  Learning objectives 

By the end of this module, you'll be able to:

- Describe the purpose of AI agents
- Explain the key features of Azure AI Foundry Agent Service
- Build an agent using the Foundry Agent Service
- Integrate an agent in the Foundry Agent Service into your own application

## Prerequisites

- Familiarity with Azure and the Azure portal.
- An understanding of generative AI. You can learn more with [Fundamentals of Generative AI](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/fundamentals-generative-ai/).

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

Take the module assessment

 Module Assessment Results

Assess your understanding of this module. Sign in and answer all questions correctly to earn a pass designation on your profile.

- [Introduction](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/1-introduction)
- [What is an AI agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/2-what-is-ai-agent)
- [How to use Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/3-how-use-agent-service)
- [Develop agents with the Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/4-when-use-agent-service)
- [Exercise - Build an AI agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/5-exercise)
- [Module assessment](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/6-knowledge-check)
- [Summary](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/7-summary)

Take the module assessment

 Module Assessment Results

Assess your understanding of this module. Sign in and answer all questions correctly to earn a pass designation on your profile.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/"},{"title":"Develop AI Agents on Azure - Training","content":"# Develop AI agents on Azure

- Learning Path
- 7 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure AI services](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=ai-services&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[AI Engineer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=ai-engineer&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=artificial-intelligence&resource_type=learning%20path)[Machine learning](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=machine-learning&resource_type=learning%20path)[Natural language processing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=natural-language-processing&resource_type=learning%20path)

Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming more functional and accessible, and AI agents are a key component of this evolution. This learning path will help you understand the AI agents, including when to use them and how to build them, using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service and Semantic Kernel Agent Framework. By the end of this learning path, you will have the skills needed to develop AI agents on Azure.

## Prerequisites

Before starting this module, you should be familiar with fundamental AI concepts and services in Azure. Consider completing the [Get started with artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/get-started-with-artificial-intelligence-on-azure) learning path first.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Get started with AI agent development on Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/ai-agent-fundamentals/)

AI agents represent the next generation of intelligent applications. Learn how they can be developed and used on Microsoft Azure.

[Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/)

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building agents with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.

[Integrate custom tools into your agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-agent-with-custom-tools/)

Built-in tools are useful, but they may not meet all your needs. In this module, learn how to extend the capabilities of your agent by integrating custom tools for your agent to use.

[Develop an AI agent with Semantic Kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-with-semantic-kernel/)

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building Azure AI Foundry Agent Service agents with Semantic Kernel.

[Orchestrate a multi-agent solution using Semantic Kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/orchestrate-semantic-kernel-multi-agent-solution/)

Learn how to use the Semantic Kernel SDK to develop your own AI agents that can collaborate for a multi-agent solution.

[Develop a multi-agent solution with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)

Break down complex tasks with intelligent collaboration. Learn how to design multi-agent solutions using connected agents.

[Integrate MCP Tools with Azure AI Agents](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/connect-agent-to-mcp-tools/)

Enable dynamic tool access for your Azure AI agents. Learn how to connect MCP-hosted tools and integrate them seamlessly into agent workflows.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/develop-ai-agents-on-azure/"},{"title":"Tutorial: Idea to prototype - Build and evaluate an enterprise agent","content":"# Tutorial: Idea to prototype - Build and evaluate an enterprise agent
## Understand the assistant implementation
```csharp
var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();

projectClient = new AIProjectClient(new Uri(projectEndpoint), credential);
Console.WriteLine($"✅ Connected to Azure AI Foundry: {projectEndpoint}");
```
### Create the SharePoint tool for the agent
The agent uses SharePoint and can access company policy and procedure documents stored there. Set up the connection to SharePoint in your code.
**Python**
**C#**
### Create the MCP tool for the agent
**Python**
**C#**
### Create the agent and connect the tools
Create the agent and connect the SharePoint and MCP tools.
**Python**
**C#**
### Converse with the agent
Finally, implement an interactive loop to converse with the agent.
**Python**
```python
print("🤖 AGENT RESPONSE:")
response, status = create_agent_response(agent, scenario["question"], openai_client)
```
**C#**
```csharp
Console.WriteLine("🤖 ASSISTANT RESPONSE:");
var (response, status) = await ChatWithAssistantAsync(scenario.Question);
```
### Expected output from agent sample code
When you run the agent, you see output similar to the following example. The output shows successful tool configuration and agent responses to business scenarios:","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/tutorials/developer-journey-idea-to-prototype?view=foundry#understand-the-assistant-implementation"}]}

results.title: Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Create an AI agent
results.content:
# Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Create an AI agent
## Purpose of this document
This study guide provides a summary of the topics covered in the assessment lab, along with additional resources to help you prepare. Note that the learning path on the credential details page may include more modules than the "Tasks performed" to provide a cohesive learning experience.
### Tasks at a glance
#### Create and configure agents by using the Microsoft Foundry portal
1. Create an agent project or a new agent
2. Create a new completion model deployment
3. Configure agent settings, including name, description, and instructions
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Get started with AI agent development on Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/ai-agent-fundamentals/)
#### Add knowledge sources and tools to an agent
1. Add files to the agent's vector store
2. Specify a connection to a knowledge source
3. Add a tool to the agent, such as Code Interpreter or an API tool
4. Test knowledge sources and tools by submitting user queries
  Supporting module (s):
4.1. [Develop a multi-agent solution with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)
#### Orchestrate multiple agents
1. Configure a connected agent
2. Test agent-to-agent conversation by submitting user queries
  Supporting module (s):
2.1. [Develop a multi-agent solution with Microsoft Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)

results.title: Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Develop AI agents using Microsoft Azure OpenAI and Semantic Kernel
results.content:
# Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Develop AI agents using Microsoft Azure OpenAI and Semantic Kernel
## Purpose of this document
This study guide provides a summary of the topics covered in the assessment lab, along with additional resources to help you prepare. Note that the learning path on the credential details page may include more modules than the "Tasks performed" to provide a cohesive learning experience.
### Tasks at a glance
#### Prepare the development environment
1. Deploy an Azure OpenAI Service model
2. Retrieve and store an endpoint and a key
3. Create a new console application
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Build your kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/build-your-kernel/)
#### Run prompts with Semantic Kernel
1. Create a Semantic Kernel object
2. Create and run a prompt
  Supporting module (s):
2.1. [Create plugins for semantic kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-plugins-semantic-kernel/)
#### Improve the prompt
1. Refine the prompt to be more specific, such as changing the output format or the style
2. Define message roles in chat completion prompts
3. Add variables to the prompt
4. Add context to the prompt by using the ChatHistory object
5. Configure few-shot prompting
6. Save the prompt as a file
  Supporting module (s):
6.1. [Create plugins for semantic kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-plugins-semantic-kernel/)
#### Create native plug-ins for Semantic Kernel
1. Create native plug-ins for Semantic Kernel
2. Create and decorate a plug-in class
3. Invoke native function manually
4. Invoke native function automatically
5. Combine prompts and functions
  Supporting module (s):
5.1. [Give your AI agent skills](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/give-your-ai-agent-skills/)
#### Implement nested functions
1. Embed core plug-ins, including conversation summary and time
2. Use the Handlebars template prompt
3. Create and embed a custom nested function
  Supporting module (s):
3.1. [Combine Prompts and Functions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/combine-prompts-functions/)
3.2. [Give your AI agent skills](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/give-your-ai-agent-skills/)
#### Improve automation by using planners
1. Create a Handlebars planner
2. Create and run a plan
3. Save a plan
4. Optimize a plan by modifying the template
  Supporting module (s):
4.1. [Use intelligent planners](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/use-intelligent-planners/)
4.2. [Guided project - Create an AI travel agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/guided-project-create-ai-travel-agent/)

results.title: Step 1: Your First Agent (programming-language-csharp)
results.content:
# Step 1: Your First Agent (programming-language-csharp)
Create an agent and get a response — in just a few lines of code.
```dotnetcli
dotnet add package Azure.AI.OpenAI --prerelease
dotnet add package Azure.Identity
dotnet add package Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI --prerelease
```
Create the agent:
Run it:
```csharp
Console.WriteLine(await agent.RunAsync("What is the largest city in France?"));
```
Or stream the response:
```csharp
await foreach (var update in agent.RunStreamingAsync("Tell me a one-sentence fun fact."))
{
    Console.Write(update);
}
```
Tip
See the [full sample](https://github.com/microsoft/agent-framework/blob/main/dotnet/samples/01-get-started/01_HelloAgent.cs) for the complete runnable file.

# Study guide for the Applied Skills assessment lab: Build a generative AI chat app

#### Implement chat history

2. Write code to add user and agent messages to the object
3. Write code to add chat history to the conversation context
  Supporting module (s):

Applied Skills 

# Microsoft Applied Skills: Develop generative AI apps with Azure OpenAI and Semantic Kernel

 Validate your technical skills and open doors to new possibilities of advancement with Microsoft Applied Skills. 

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?levels=intermediate&credential_types=applied%20skills)
- Product

[Natural language processing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/browse/?subjects=natural-language-processing&credential_types=applied%20skills)

## Overview

Warning

The English language version of this Applied Skill assessment lab was updated on April 30, 2025. Review the study guide linked in the Applied Skills resources section for details about these changes.

To earn this Microsoft Applied Skills credential, learners demonstrate the ability to develop AI agents by using Azure OpenAI Service and the Semantic Kernel SDK.

Candidates for this credential should be familiar with Visual Studio Code, C# programming, and Azure OpenAI.

### Skills earned upon completion

results.title: Introduction to Microsoft AI Agent Solutions - Training
results.content:
# Introduction to Microsoft AI agent solutions

- Module
- 8 Units

 Beginner 

 Developer 

 App Maker 

 Azure 

 Microsoft 365 Copilot 

 Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat 

 Microsoft Copilot Studio 

Explore Microsoft AI agent solutions and gain clarity on when to adopt, extend, or develop custom agent solutions based on your scenario and objectives.

## Learning objectives

After completing this module, you should be able to:

- Identify core use cases for the out-of-the-box capabilities of Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot Chat, and first-party agents.
- Describe options for customizing and extending Microsoft 365 Copilot.
- Identify scenarios where building fully custom AI agents or generative AI applications is appropriate.
- Identify the key Microsoft development tools available for designing, building, extending, and deploying AI agents.
- Evaluate which Microsoft AI agent path best fits a given scenario.

## Prerequisites

- Familiarity with Microsoft 365 Copilot
- Basic knowledge of generative AI concepts (agent, model, orchestration, etc.)
- Familiarity with core Microsoft Cloud platforms (Microsoft 365, Power Platform, and Azure)

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

- [Introduction](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/1-introduction)
- [The Microsoft AI agent ecosystem](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/2-ai-agent-solutions-microsoft)
- [Maximize Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot Chat, and agents](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/3-microsoft-365-copilot-copilot-chat)
- [Customize and extend Microsoft 365 Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/4-customize-extend-microsoft-365-copilot)
- [Build custom AI agents and applications](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/5-build-custom-ai-agents-applications)
- [Compare AI agent solutions](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/6-choose-your-agent-solution)
- [Module assessment](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/7-knowledge-check)
- [Summary](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-ai-agent-solutions/8-summary)

Take the module assessment

 Module Assessment Results

Assess your understanding of this module. Sign in and answer all questions correctly to earn a pass designation on your profile.

results.title: Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service - Training
results.content:
# Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service

- Module
- 7 Units

 Intermediate 

 AI Engineer 

 Developer 

 Solution Architect 

 Student 

 Azure OpenAI Service 

 Azure 

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building agents with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.

##  Learning objectives 

By the end of this module, you'll be able to:

- Describe the purpose of AI agents
- Explain the key features of Azure AI Foundry Agent Service
- Build an agent using the Foundry Agent Service
- Integrate an agent in the Foundry Agent Service into your own application

## Prerequisites

- Familiarity with Azure and the Azure portal.
- An understanding of generative AI. You can learn more with [Fundamentals of Generative AI](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/fundamentals-generative-ai/).

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?icid=msft_learn)

Take the module assessment

 Module Assessment Results

Assess your understanding of this module. Sign in and answer all questions correctly to earn a pass designation on your profile.

- [What is an AI agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/2-what-is-ai-agent)
- [How to use Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/3-how-use-agent-service)
- [Develop agents with the Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/4-when-use-agent-service)
- [Exercise - Build an AI agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/5-exercise)
- [Module assessment](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/6-knowledge-check)

results.title: Develop AI Agents on Azure - Training
results.content:
# Develop AI agents on Azure

- Learning Path
- 7 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure AI services](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=ai-services&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[AI Engineer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=ai-engineer&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=artificial-intelligence&resource_type=learning%20path)[Machine learning](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=machine-learning&resource_type=learning%20path)[Natural language processing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=natural-language-processing&resource_type=learning%20path)

Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming more functional and accessible, and AI agents are a key component of this evolution. This learning path will help you understand the AI agents, including when to use them and how to build them, using Azure AI Foundry Agent Service and Semantic Kernel Agent Framework. By the end of this learning path, you will have the skills needed to develop AI agents on Azure.

## Prerequisites

Before starting this module, you should be familiar with fundamental AI concepts and services in Azure. Consider completing the [Get started with artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/get-started-with-artificial-intelligence-on-azure) learning path first.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Get started with AI agent development on Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/ai-agent-fundamentals/)

AI agents represent the next generation of intelligent applications. Learn how they can be developed and used on Microsoft Azure.

[Develop an AI agent with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/)

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building agents with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service.

[Integrate custom tools into your agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-agent-with-custom-tools/)

Built-in tools are useful, but they may not meet all your needs. In this module, learn how to extend the capabilities of your agent by integrating custom tools for your agent to use.

[Develop an AI agent with Semantic Kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-with-semantic-kernel/)

This module provides engineers with the skills to begin building Azure AI Foundry Agent Service agents with Semantic Kernel.

[Orchestrate a multi-agent solution using Semantic Kernel](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/orchestrate-semantic-kernel-multi-agent-solution/)

Learn how to use the Semantic Kernel SDK to develop your own AI agents that can collaborate for a multi-agent solution.

[Develop a multi-agent solution with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-multi-agent-azure-ai-foundry/)

Break down complex tasks with intelligent collaboration. Learn how to design multi-agent solutions using connected agents.

[Integrate MCP Tools with Azure AI Agents](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/connect-agent-to-mcp-tools/)

Enable dynamic tool access for your Azure AI agents. Learn how to connect MCP-hosted tools and integrate them seamlessly into agent workflows.

results.title: Tutorial: Idea to prototype - Build and evaluate an enterprise agent
results.content:
# Tutorial: Idea to prototype - Build and evaluate an enterprise agent
## Understand the assistant implementation
```csharp
var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();

projectClient = new AIProjectClient(new Uri(projectEndpoint), credential);
Console.WriteLine($"✅ Connected to Azure AI Foundry: {projectEndpoint}");
```
### Create the SharePoint tool for the agent
The agent uses SharePoint and can access company policy and procedure documents stored there. Set up the connection to SharePoint in your code.
**Python**
**C#**
### Create the MCP tool for the agent
**Python**
**C#**
### Create the agent and connect the tools
Create the agent and connect the SharePoint and MCP tools.
**Python**
**C#**
### Converse with the agent
Finally, implement an interactive loop to converse with the agent.
**Python**
```python
print("🤖 AGENT RESPONSE:")
response, status = create_agent_response(agent, scenario["question"], openai_client)
```
**C#**
```csharp
Console.WriteLine("🤖 ASSISTANT RESPONSE:");
var (response, status) = await ChatWithAssistantAsync(scenario.Question);
```
### Expected output from agent sample code
When you run the agent, you see output similar to the following example. The output shows successful tool configuration and agent responses to business scenarios:
